job_title: Financial Aid Technician in Harrisburg, PA
pros: Great environment, hour lunches, paid time off during holidays, co-workers and supervisors are genuinely great people and easy to get along with, good pension plan.
cons: Understaffed and overworked for low pay.

pros: Got to interact with students and practice more problems

job_title: Professional Writing Tutor in Harrisburg, PA
pros: I started out as a peer tutor when I was a student there, became a casual peer tutor when I transferred schools, and then stayed on as a professional once I got my bachelor's, and the pay scale increases accordingly. We have an all-day paid training at the start of each major semester, and they always include fun activities and useful information. My bosses and coworkers are a dream to work with--very communicative and supportive--and I don't go a single week without feeling appreciated. There are several ways to be a writing tutor, too, from meeting with students on a first-come, first-served basis on campus to working with specific professors and classes to even tutoring asynchronously through our submissions inbox, the HOWL (HACC Online Writing Lab). The hours you work are based entirely on your availability, which they poll for every semester.
cons: The maximum number of hours you can work each week as a tutor is 20, so there's no full-time opportunity.

job_title: User Support Specialist in Harrisburg, PA

job_title: Business Data Analyst in Harrisburg, PA
pros: 1: Summer schedule: Monday-Thursday. 2: Christmas break: a whole week off which does not take away from your PTO. 3: Starting PTO is 20 days. 4: I loved my job and the people I worked with
cons:
1: The abundance of meetings. Each week I was in meetings at least 8 hours per week. A lot of the meetings could be substituted with an email to the group.

2: My manager continually brought trivial matters to the forefront of our one-on-one meetings. A quick example is I accidentally confused my manager's name with another manager's name during a meeting. I corrected my mistake during the meeting and thought nothing of it until my manager brought it to my attention during a one-on-one meeting. She was deeply offended by my mistake and became very upset when I did not sympathize with her. Once trivial items like that became the primary topic of discussion with my manager, I knew there was no hope in me retaining my position at HACC.

3: Multiple items that were included in my performance review were never discussed in person and items discussed in person did not make it into my performance review.

4: You can do your job well, be respected and liked by your co-workers and customers, and still have your manager dislike you which ultimately leads to your termination.

pros: Wonderful people; professional atmosphere; beautiful grounds; nice cafeteria.
cons: Upper management cares nothing about their people or the years of knowledge and experience the employees have.  Dozens of good people have been left go. They are only interested in the bottom line and their reputation with the community and the students.  They have no idea what they are doing and love change simply for change's sake.  Their motto is, "If it's not broken, let's fix it!"  So much money is wasted in this process. They refuse to take ownership of any problems, such as budget deficits and make the employees pay for it.  If I could give them a zero star, I would.  The absolute worst!

review_title: Great mission, excellent instructor support, some recent changes
pros: I really enjoy the mission of HACC.  I think we offer excellent affordable educational opportunities for a wide variety of people to meet their educational goals.
cons: It has always been a place where there was great support for instructors and students.  I could always find help when I needed it.  Lately there have been a lot of changes.  This makes it a little confusing, but there has been a significant effort given to communicating the changes, polling faculty, staff and students about their views, and the high quality of instruction and support is still evident.  They have had some new practices and new requirements that were never communicated with faculty until discussed in individual reviews.  Very poor form, but I think not typical and I am hopeful that this important communication gap will be addressed.

pros: Good students to work with
cons:
Administration would not support the majority of the needs of the program I taught in. The classroom space was not conducive for the type of class that was expected to be taught. When I brought up major concerns about safety it was often ignored. Clearly the motivation was about numbers in the classroom vs. the education of the students.

Coworkers were very territorial and not willing to work together to improve the program.

Management and administration kept changing so it would be very difficult to figure out who would be a point person for certain things.

I worked here for two years and this job caused a great deal of stress that was not worth the time or compensation. I was so happy to quit and I do not miss working at HACC. I miss my students, but that is it.

review_title: Students are important but remember so too is the staff
pros: There are some great people at HACC who really care about the students and that is as it should be. There are a great variety of programs and HACC gives opportunities to people from all different opportunity levels and that is a significant part of its heart.
cons: HACC use to be a great place to work. The culture changed to one of fear and distrust when the current leadership came in. Once trust was lost, there did not seem to be any real attempt to regain and rebuild it. Probably impossible at this point.

review_title: A Great Example of "The Community College Experience".
pros: It is a great college with dedicated staff, always eager to help it's students! It also has a family atmosphere that I know helps the students to move forward during their time here.
cons: One issue that the college consistently has is issues with technology. There are computers for the students to use, but they are not always working properly. I have also often heard that complaint from teachers trying to use computers during their classes. That needs to be better addressed, to assist both students and faculty.

pros: The Learning Center staff and fellow student tutors were friendly, and the overall environment in the Learning Center is friendly.  The pay is decent considering I've had much worse and more demanding jobs that paid less.  Schedules are flexible and are set when you say are available (though if you're schedule is very limited, be prepared to be asked multiple times if you can work on additional days).
cons:
No one seems to know any real information.  My first paycheck was late because I was not given a form that had to be filled out.  It was not my mistake, but I had to wait another two weeks for a paycheck (which I really needed for groceries).  The form was submitted about two weeks before payday, yet they couldn't get that first paycheck to me in time.  (Payday is 14 days after the pay period ends, falling just under the legal limit of 15 days.)  The ending date for student tutors for the semester was also very vague because of additional snow make-up days.

At times, the work itself was very headache-inducing.  As a HACC student, I know that some instructors require students to go to the Learning Center and get a signature for an assignment.  It seemed to me that some instructors also sent students to the Learning Center rather than teaching them properly.  Student tutors are not instructors, neither in education levels nor in pay.  It actually seemed as if these instructors were trying to prove that the Learning Center (and the library) is worth funding, and so they forced students to go there.

There were a lot of tech problems -- IT was in the Learning Center fixing problems more often than should be required.  The computers and the printer would randomly have issues.  I know that one day during finals the printers in both the Learning Center and the library were down.  Two of us wanted to print additional notes for an open-book test and could not because of the tech problems.

pros: Work life balance, decent pay, and tuition assistance.  Four day workweeks during the summer.  Christmas and Thanksgiving vacation. Low healthcare costs.
cons: Poor training and negative coworkers unwilling to work collaboratively.  Coworkers are territorial, do not want to share knowledge, and gossip about their managers and coworkers. Would much rather complain than address issues.  It was so bad, even with all the benefits, leaving was the best option.

review_title: A amazing college with a rich history and traditionally excellent programs, currently facing an uncertain future.
pros: The colleagues and friendships I have developed over the years have been invaluable. The experience I have gained has enriched my life. Also, its a beautiful campus!
cons: Teaching schedule varies GREATLY each semester. Often not given enough notice to prepare a course before a semester starts.

review_title: so many jobs would be great if the person in charge had some decency
pros: teaching is great fun, excellent pay for hours, workload fair
cons: length of service is seen as a negative rather than a positive, expectations regarding performance are unrealistic, if you want time off, forget it. Adjunct faculty do not receive benefits. After 5 years you can take a free class or two and your family too, but getting the paperwork completed to do so is arduous. Former students often complain of incompentent advising and unfair treatment.

review_title: A great place to cut your teeth in the teaching community and really help students
pros: Highly flexible, committed team of professionals who encourage you to create the best classroom environment to your standards. Dedicated office space with many useful resources.
cons: Occasionally sloppy communication between departments can cause problems; lack of stability between semesters is detrimental to long-term budgeting and forecasting.

pros: Outstanding educational institution. Student centered learning environment
cons: HACC is currently going through reorganization;  they are insuring it has no impact on students' learning but the staff and faculty are experiencing both challenging and stressful moments in the reorganization process

review_title: Great student job in a very nice atmosphere!
pros:
- Communicative and administrative tasks in the Learning Center
- Very nice atmosphere in the team, nice and helpful colleagues
- Contact to a lot of students
- Great job besides studies, options to study in free time
cons: During my work I could not find any negative aspect

pros: Working for the paper and selling advertising was fun. I got to meet a lot of interesting people with eclectic personalities.
cons: The student advisor was not very business minded and it was difficult to get her to understand that business deals can take some time to work out.

pros: Great flexible schedule with work/life balance.
cons: President has created a culture of fear. He makes decisions on a whim without thought to ramifications. Lay offs occur without warning or planning to replace employee functions. Standard Policies are not followed. Management makes up their own policies which change frequently. Working there for over 20 years means nothing. Management does not care about employees. No pay raise for three years.

pros:
Working with people that have passion for education.
Good hourly wage for adjunct faculty.
Minimal stress job.
cons:
No advancement without a college degree. Makes sense being a college, but within the work force, shouldn't be mandatory.
Not many raises to salary.

review_title: Peer Tutor in Learning Center-flexible/rewarding, pay not great
pros: Positive workplace where a student tutor can interact with fellow students who need assistance.  Professional tutors who also share the space. Flexible work shifts.
cons: $8/hr for tiresome work (it hurts your brain)

review_title: Peer Tutor for Computer Information Systems
pros: Learning how to understand people and obtaining the abilities to present a solution in multiple ways. So overall experience with Microsoft Office and communication skills.
cons: Not having all the tools to better assist peers.

job_title: Business Analyst, Student Services in Harrisburg, PA
pros: Good team of people to work with in IT and Student Affairs.
cons: In the midst of a re-organization (2019-2020). Things are going to be unsettled this year.

pros:
Content of the work
Weekends and holidays off
Co-workers
Benefits
cons: Not many cons that the organization has.  It was a transition from being a novice educator but everyone was helpful and supportive.

review_title: I had over 18 years of good employment at HACC.
pros: Some sites are like family. Benefits are generally good.
cons: The current atmosphere is not as good as it used to be.

pros: Great, friendly people, always willing to help and you feel part of a team here.

pros: Diverse, great benefits for full time employees!

cons: old school in some ways

pros: The other faculty truly care about the future of HACC.
cons: The administration does what they want without a full plan in place.
